root.name: > Print Culture and the Modern World

7.name: Chinese paper reached Europe via Silk Route (11th century)
Marco Polo brought woodblock printing knowledge to Italy (1295)
Italians began woodblock books; technology spread
High demand increased manuscript production (scribes employed by booksellers)
Limitations of Manuscripts (expensive, laborious, fragile, limited circulation)
Woodblocks used widely by early 15th century (textiles, cards, religious pictures)

8.name: Adapted existing technology (olive press model, lead moulds for trinkets)
Innovation: Moveable Type Printing Machine (metal types for alphabet)
First printed book: The Bible (180 copies in 3 years)
Initial printed books resembled manuscripts (hand-illuminated borders)
Boom in Production (1450 1550): 20 million to 200 million copies
Shift from hand printing to mechanical printing = Print Revolution
